item.title: The Max-Min Inequality
item.description: One of my favorite results in optimization is the max-min inequality. This is taught in just about every introductory course in optimization, math. for econ, and/or allied courses. The result is as follows. The Result Consider a bivariate function \(f(z, w)\), \(z \in Z\), \(w \in W\). Itâ€™s easier to think of the sets \(Z\) and \(W\) as finite sets, or a convex subset of \(\mathbb{R}\) (although the result is more general).
